column1: Mix mozzarella cheese and Parmesan Reggiano cheese together in a bowl until smooth. Stuff 1 tablespoon cheese mixture into each zucchini blossom and pinch the ends closed. Mix rice flour
column5: sweet rice flour

column7: and pepper together in a bowl. Place stuffed blossoms in flour mixture
column8: toss gently until covered. Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Fry blossoms in oil until crisp and pale golden brown
column9: about 2 minutes. Rest blossoms on paper towels to absorb excess oil.

column1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Unroll crescent dough. Pinch or press the perforation between the triangles to get 4 rectangular pieces. Cut rectangles in half lengthwise so you have 8 narrow strips. Make a 2-inch slice through the center of one end of a hot dog. Cut two more 2-inch slices on either side of that
column2: so that the 'legs' are about the same thickness. Repeat on the other end. Cut 'legs' into the remaining hot dogs. Roll a crescent strip around the center of each dog. Place spider dogs on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown
column3: about 11 minutes. Dip a chopstick into some ketchup and dot eyes onto each spider. Serve with remaining ketchup.

column13: until chicken is tender and cooked through. Transfer chicken to a plate and shred with two forks. Return to pot and add white beans and corn. Bring to a simmer and let cook

column1: Preheat a waffle maker that makes round waffles on medium. Prepare the boxed cake mix according to the package directions. Pour one third cup of the batter into the center of the waffle maker
column2: close the lid and cook until the cake is lightly browned and springs back when you touch it
column3: 1 to 1 half minutes. Remove the cake from the waffle maker using a fork and set aside on a wire rack to cool completely. Repeat with the remaining batter
column4: you should have 8 waffled cakes total. Let them all cool completely. Pulse the raspberries with the confectioners' sugar in a food processor until it looks like dust. Add the mascarpone
column5: vanilla and 1 cup cream and pulse until thick and creamy. Put the chocolate chips in a medium bowl. Heat the remaining half cup cream in a small saucepan over medium heat until small bubbles form and it just begins to simmer. Pour the cream over the chocolate and stir until melted and smooth. Put 1 waffled cake on a cake stand or plate. Use an offset spatula to evenly spread a quarter cup of the raspberry-cream mixture over the cake
column6: pushing most of it to the edge of the cake
column7: leaving a small well in the middle. Spoon 1 tablespoon of the chocolate ganache into the well and top with another waffled cake. Repeat with remaining waffled cakes
column9: finishing with some raspberry cream on top. Decorate the top with the fresh raspberries and drizzle with the remaining ganache (microwave the ganache for a few seconds and stir if it needs to be loosened). If desired
column10: dust with confectioners' sugar before serving.
